result.execSummary:
The defendant Adonis N Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: No weapons or firearms unless for taking firearm safety class.

Provide DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all nonwaivable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adonis N Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adonis N Mitchell in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Adonis N Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days  in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days served. Huber for work. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- No weapons or firearms unless for taking firearm safety class.
- Take a firearm safety class.
- Provide DNA sample.

Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights.

Defendant Adonis N Mitchell in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adonis N Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests to resolve the case through a plea and sentencing.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Adonis N Mitchell in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adonis N Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense still needs an offer from the state.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department 07/04/21
Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department 07/04/22

Defendant Adonis N Mitchell in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adonis N Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered $500.00 cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adonis N Mitchell in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@02:30pm
